page.title: 01THE KIRKBY STEPHEN AREA
page.content: {Kirkby Stephen }is a small {market {town }at the head of the {Eden Valley. Set in countryside of exceptional natural beauty it lies between two { {National Parks,}the {Lake District } and the {Yorkshire Dales.}There is a growing awareness of the appeal of the Upper Eden to fell walkers and other lovers of the countryside.The{Coast to {Coast footpath}and other long distance paths have encouragad this process. The{small size}of Kirkby Stephen, population about 1600, belies its importance as a{centre}for a large sparsely populated {farming}area containing several small villages. The distance from any larger towns (Penrith and Kendal are about 25 miles away) has created a largely {self-contained community}with a wide range of facilities which fulfils most normal needs.
